tokens.definition: בָּבֶל Bâbel, baw-bel'; from H1101 ; confusion; Babel (i.e. Babylon), including Babylonia and the Babylonian empire:—Babel, Babylon. Note by BLB: Strong's entry lists the pronunciation of this word with the "b" sound. This is incorrect. The ב (bet) does not have a daghesh lene so it is pronounced with a "v" sound. This is why the transliteration has a bar under the "b" (ḇ).
tokens.kjv_translation_count: Babylon (257x), Babylonian (with H 1121) (3x), Babel (2x).

tokens.definition: בָּבֶל Bâbel, baw-bel'; from H1101 ; confusion; Babel (i.e. Babylon), including Babylonia and the Babylonian empire:—Babel, Babylon. Note by BLB: Strong's entry lists the pronunciation of this word with the "b" sound. This is incorrect. The ב (bet) does not have a daghesh lene so it is pronounced with a "v" sound. verses.text_plain: For, lo, I begin to bring evil on the city which is called by my name, and should ye be utterly unpunished? Ye shall not be unpunished: for I will call for a sword upon all the inhabitants of the earth, saith the Lord of hosts.
verses.verse_html:
29For, lo, I begin to bring evil on the city which is called by my name, and should ye be utterly unpunished? Ye shall not be unpunished: for I will call for a sword upon all the inhabitants of the earth, saith the Lord of hosts. ▼
▼ which…: Heb. upon which my name is called

verses.text_plain: Therefore prophesy thou against them all these words, and say unto them, The Lord shall roar from on high, and utter his voice from his holy habitation; he shall mightily roar upon his habitation; he shall give a shout, as they that tread the grapes, against all the inhabitants of the earth.
verses.verse_html: 30Therefore prophesy thou against them all these words, and say unto them, The Lord shall roar from on high, and utter his voice from his holy habitation; he shall mightily roar upon his habitation; he shall give a shout, as they that tread the grapes, against all the inhabitants of the earth.

verses.text_plain: He hath forsaken his covert, as the lion: for their land is desolate because of the fierceness of the oppressor, and because of his fierce anger.
verses.verse_html:
38He hath forsaken his covert, as the lion: for their land is desolate because of the fierceness of the oppressor, and because of his fierce anger. ▼
▼ desolate: Heb. a desolation
